title: Fashion Designer Virgil Abloh Dies of Cancer at Age 41; Founder of the Off-White brand became menswear creative director for LVMH's Louis Vuitton
text:
"He chose to endure his battle privately since his diagnosis in 2019, undergoing numerous challenging treatments, all while helming several significant institutions that span fashion, art and culture," the post said.

Mr. Abloh founded his fashion house, Off-White, in 2013, shaking up luxury fashion with collections that featured sneakers and camouflage pants juxtaposed with evening gowns. Such flourishes are now common in the collections of the biggest luxury brands.

In July, Mr. Abloh sold a 60% stake in the Off-White trademark to LVMH MoÃ«t Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the Paris-based luxury conglomerate. Mr. Abloh was also named as the creative director of menswear at Louis Vuitton, LVMH's core brand and the top-selling label in luxury fashion.

"Virgil was not only a genius designer, a visionary, he was also a man with a beautiful soul and a great wisdom," said Bernard Arnault, the French billionaire who is chief executive and controlling shareholder of LVMH.
